summary:
9. Commends the outcome of the Darfur International Conference on water and calls on UNAMID and other UN agencies to meet their commitments.

10. Expresses concern over persistent localized conflicts and violence, and calls on all parties to end inter-tribal clashes and pursue reconciliation.

11. Demands that parties to the conflict protect civilians, including women and children, from all forms of sexual violence, and requests UNAMID to report on sexual and gender-based violence.
The Security Council:

 Requests the Secretary-General to ensure implementation of resolutions 1325, 1820, 1888, 1889, and 1960 by UNAMID, including appointment of women protection advisors and participation of women, and to report on this.

 Requests the Secretary-General to monitor and report on the situation of children, and engage with parties to prepare time-bound action plans to end recruitment and use of child soldiers.

 Requests the Secretary-General to review and update UNAMID's concept of operations and rules of engagement, and report to the Council and troop-contributing countries.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
